news.title: ‘Tom Niland protected rural Ireland by taking these guys out of the system' - community pays tribute to farmer on day of ‘relief’
news.summary: The obscene brutality of the attack that led to the death of bachelor farmer Tom Niland remains a permanent scar in the hearts of his community.

news.title: Woman who tripped over vacuum cleaner in Supermac’s has personal injuries claim dismissed
news.summary: A woman had her personal injuries claim against fast-food restaurant Supermac’s dismissed after a judge found she was “wholly distracted” by her phone when she claimed she tripped over a hoover.

news.title: ‘Historic low’ – just 6,325 house commencement notices this year, the lowest rate since lockdown
news.summary: There were only 1,356 commencement notices for new homes lodged in June, the lowest total for that month since 2020, during the Covid lockdown.

news.title: Sliotargate and the donkey derby – hurling’s bitter rivalry between Tipperary and Cork is reborn
news.summary: First things first. Avid horse racing fan Babs Keating was not specifically talking about Cork when he used that unfortunate metaphor about donkeys not winning derbies before the 1990 Munster final … it’s just that’s how his words were manipulated to suit the narrative.

news.title: RTÉ still waiting on breakdown of Eurovision televoting despite request in May
news.summary: RTÉ has still not received a detailed breakdown of this year’s Eurovision televoting figures from the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), despite requesting the numbers eight weeks ago.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Trump’s broken promises: Why the Epstein files are causing a MAGA meltdown
news.summary: Six years ago, notorious paedophile Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his New York City prison cell.

news.title: Bill Linnane: I’m conscious of making the most of my time with my kids – shame I can’t understand a word they’re saying
news.summary: I try to keep up with youth culture. It could be trying to figure out what ‘skibidi Ohio rizz’ means, investigating the cold case killing of John Pork by Tim Cheese, or even becoming conversationally fluent in Italian Brainrot.

news.title: ‘There’s no need for anyone to own 15 pairs of leggings’ – how I made hundreds of euro selling my clutter on Vinted
news.summary: In just one month, I made hundreds of euro by selling my stuff rather than throwing it away.

news.title: Modern Morals: My verbally abusive brother is basically squatting in my house and won’t leave. How do I get him out?
Dónal Lynch: Gregg Wallace showed that no matter how bad a situation is for a public figure, they can always make it worse
news.summary: Gregg Wallace ­finally got there. Like a ­ MasterChef  contestant frantically rushing to plate up in time for the gong, Wallace ­belatedly said he was “deeply sorry” this week for the long list of now proven allegations against him.
